alert.note: Alert for Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 1:24AM CDT until June 03 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Hockley and Terry Counties. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 120 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Rainfall rates of 2 to 4 inches per hour are occurring with some of these storms. This will result in minor flooding over the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen west of Highway 385. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Levelland, Brownfield, Sundown, Anton, Locketville, Tokio, Whitharral, Meadow, Smyer, Ropesville, Wellman and Opdyke West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
